channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How 3 Muslim sisters helped change the rules of American women's wrestling
item.description: Jamilah, Zaynah and Latifah McBryde grew up wrestling one another in Buffalo, N.Y. Coaches recognized their talent, but they couldn't wear the require...

item.title: As Democrats spoil for a fight, a new face in the House is leading them on oversight
item.description: Rep. Robert Garcia is the new top Democrat on the House Oversight Committee. At a moment when his party is craving more confrontation with President T...

item.title: New Hampshire judge blocks Trump birthright citizenship executive order nationwide
item.description: A federal judge in New Hampshire on Thursday blocked President Trump's executive order that attempted to end birthright citizenship, stopping it from ...

item.title: How flood sirens could have saved lives in Texas
item.description: In the wake of the deadly flash floods in Texas, state leaders are exploring whether to install more flood warning sirens. Such sirens can save lives ...

item.title: What AI bot started referring to itself as 'MechaHitler'? Find out in the quiz
item.description: Elon Musk and his AI have been busy. So has the TSA. And Amazon. Were you paying attention?

item.title: Nigeria has 'enough problems' and can't take deportees from US, minister says
item.description: Nigeria cannot accept Venezuelans because "we already have over 230 million people," says the foreign minister.

item.title: Iran could recover some enriched uranium after US strikes - Israeli official
item.description: The US has insisted that Iran's nuclear facilities were completely 'obliterated' during strikes in June.

item.title: Texans did not immediately receive flood alerts after request, audio reveals
item.description: A firefighter appears to have called for emergency alerts at least an hour before the first warnings were received.

item.title: Kurdish PKK burns guns in big step towards ending Turkey conflict
item.description: The ceremony took place under tight security at a cave in Iraqi Kurdistan - the disarmament process is expected to last all summer.

item.title: 7/10: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on flood rescue and recovery efforts in Texas, and how a new Barbie doll is helping thousands of children feel more seen.

item.title: Mystery interstellar object could be oldest known comet
item.description: Scientists have been racing to discover the origins of 3I/Atlas since it was spotted last week.

item.title: The secret double life of Thomas Crooks, Trump's would-be assassin
item.description: A monthslong investigation by CBS News punctures Thomas Crooks' secrecy to reveal the broadest portrait yet of the lonesome young student who tried to...

item.title: 7/10: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Budget law gives ICE the funds to ramp up mass deportations; The new documentary "Apocalypse in the Tropics" looks at religion and right-wing politics...

item.title: Why Myanmar's military ruler has welcomed Trump's tariff warning letter
item.description: The U.S. has sanctioned Myanmar's military junta and refused to acknowledge its rule, so Mr. Trump's personal letter to its leader was welcomed, despi...

item.title: Possible breakthrough in search for dozens allegedly killed by rogue cops
item.description: Fifteen police officers are under investigation over a spate of mysterious disappearances in 2022 in the country's huge cockfighting industry.

item.title: Mourning begins in Texas where more than 170 are still missing from flash floods
Head Start will be cut off for immigrants without legal status, Trump administration says
item.description: The Trump administration says it will restrict immigrants in the country illegally from enrolling in Head Start, a federally funded preschool program.

item.title: Warning sirens helped this small Texas community survive flooding
